item.title: Valve Announces New Steam Machine, Steam Controller & Steam Frame
item.description: Valve just sent over the press release announcing three new Steam Hardware devices.

item.title: Visual Studio 2026 is here: faster, smarter, and a hit with early adopters - Visual Studio Blog
item.description: Dear developers, We’re thrilled to announce that Visual Studio 2026 is now generally available! This is a moment we’ve built side by side with you. Your feedback has helped shape this release more than any before. Since the introduction of the Insiders Channel in September, more developers have downloaded and tested this preview than any […]

item.title: Simulating a Planet on the GPU: Part 1 — Patrick Celentano
item.description: Simulating a planet is hard work. The GPU makes it easer.

item.title: The Geometry Behind Normal Maps · shlom.dev
item.description: Learn how tangent space works, how to compute tangents and the TBN matrix, and how normal mapping transforms textures into detailed 3D shading.

item.title: sudo-rs Affected By Multiple Security Vulnerabilities - Impacting Ubuntu 25.10
item.description: The Ubuntu 25.10 transition to using some Rust system utilities continues proving quite rocky

item.title: Welcome to the home of the Network Time Protocol (NTP) Project.
item.description: The NTP Project conducts Research and Development in NTP, a protocol designed to synchronize the clocks of computers over a network to a common timebase.

item.title: Meta's Chief AI Scientist Yann LeCun To Depart And Launch AI Start-Up Focused On 'World Models'
item.description: (RTTNews) - Meta's (META) chief artificial intelligence scientist, Yann LeCun, plans to leave the company to launch his own AI start-up, marking a major shift inside Meta as CEO Mark Zuckerberg doubles down on "superintelligence" initiatives to compete with OpenAI and Google, acc

item.title: X5.1 solar flare, G4 geomagnetic storm watch
item.description: Here she blows! Sunspot region 4274 produced its strongest solar flare thus far since it appeared on the east limb and the sixth strongest solar flare of the current solar cycle. An impressive long duration and highly eruptive X5.1 (R3-strong) solar flare peaked this morning at 10:04 UTC.
item.author: (https://www.facebook.com/SpaceWeatherLive)
